Source.Text: Sodium metal reacts violently with chlorine gas to produce solid sodium chloride. How many liters of chlorine gas would be needed to react completely with 5.0 g of solid sodium at a pressure of 1.00 atm and a temperature of 89°C?

question.qText: Does the ideal gas law need to be used? If so, when?

aBtn.aText: <font size='16'>The ideal gas law is needed at the beginning of the problem, before doing stoichiometry.</font>
<font size='16'>The ideal gas law is needed at the end of the problem, after doing stoichiometry.</font>
<font size='16'>The ideal gas law does not need to be used. Only stoichiometry is needed.</font>
<font size='16'>The ideal gas law is needed, but stoichiometry is not necessary.</font>
